sentence1: Once a fisherman was passing there who slipped and fell into the hole.
sentence2: He came to a country full of winding ways which led over hill and dale for several miles.

sentence1: He came to a country full of winding ways which led over hill and dale for several miles.
sentence2: Finally he reached a dragon-castle lying in a great plain.

sentence1: Finally he reached a dragon-castle lying in a great plain.
sentence2: There grew a green slime which reached to his knees.

sentence1: There grew a green slime which reached to his knees.
sentence2: It was guarded by a dragon who spouted water which dispersed in a fine mist.

sentence1: It was guarded by a dragon who spouted water which dispersed in a fine mist.
sentence2: Within the gate lay a small hornless dragon who raised his head, showed his claws, and would not let him in.

sentence1: Within the gate lay a small hornless dragon who raised his head, showed his claws, and would not let him in.
sentence2: The fisherman spent several days in the cave, satisfying his hunger with the green slime, which he found edible and which tasted like rice-mush.

sentence1: The fisherman spent several days in the cave, satisfying his hunger with the green slime, which he found edible and which tasted like rice-mush.
sentence2: At last he found a way out again.

sentence1: At last he found a way out again.
sentence2: He told the district mandarin what had happened to him, and the latter reported the matter to the emperor.

sentence1: He told the district mandarin what had happened to him, and the latter reported the matter to the emperor.
sentence2: The emperor sent for a wise man and questioned him concerning it.

sentence1: The emperor sent for a wise man and questioned him concerning it.
sentence2: The wise man said: "There are four paths in this cave.

sentence1: The wise man said: "There are four paths in this cave.
sentence2: In this cave dwells the seventh daughter of the Dragon-King of the Eastern Sea, who guards his pearls and his treasure.

sentence1: In this cave dwells the seventh daughter of the Dragon-King of the Eastern Sea, who guards his pearls and his treasure.
sentence2: It happened once in the ancient days, that a fisherboy dived into the water and brought up a pearl from beneath the chin of a black dragon.

sentence1: It happened once in the ancient days, that a fisherboy dived into the water and brought up a pearl from beneath the chin of a black dragon.
sentence2: The dragon was asleep, which was the reason the fisherboy brought the pearl to the surface without being harmed.

sentence1: The dragon was asleep, which was the reason the fisherboy brought the pearl to the surface without being harmed.
sentence2: The treasure which the daughter of the Dragon-King has in charge is made up of thousands and millions of such jewels.

sentence1: The treasure which the daughter of the Dragon-King has in charge is made up of thousands and millions of such jewels.
sentence2: If one were to send a messenger with a letter, it would be possible to obtain precious pearls."

sentence1: If one were to send a messenger with a letter, it would be possible to obtain precious pearls."
sentence2: The emperor was greatly pleased, and announced a large reward for the man who was competent to go to the dragon-castle as his messenger.

sentence1: The emperor was greatly pleased, and announced a large reward for the man who was competent to go to the dragon-castle as his messenger.
sentence2: But the wise man said: "A great-great-great-great-grandfather of yours once slew more than a hundred of the dragons of the Eastern Sea, and was finally himself slain by the dragons.

sentence1: But the wise man said: "A great-great-great-great-grandfather of yours once slew more than a hundred of the dragons of the Eastern Sea, and was finally himself slain by the dragons.
sentence2: The dragons are the enemies of your family and you cannot go."

sentence1: The dragons are the enemies of your family and you cannot go."
sentence2: Then came a man from Canton, Lo-Dsi-Tschun, with his two brothers, who said that his ancestors had been related to the Dragon-King.

sentence1: Then came a man from Canton, Lo-Dsi-Tschun, with his two brothers, who said that his ancestors had been related to the Dragon-King.
sentence2: Hence they were well liked by the dragons and well known to them.

sentence1: Hence they were well liked by the dragons and well known to them.
sentence2: They begged to be entrusted with the message.

sentence1: They begged to be entrusted with the message.
sentence2: The wise man asked: "And have you still in your possession the stone which compels the dragons to do your will?"

sentence1: The wise man asked: "And have you still in your possession the stone which compels the dragons to do your will?"
sentence2: "Yes," said they, "we have brought it along with us."

sentence1: "Yes," said they, "we have brought it along with us."
sentence2: The wise man had them show him the stone;

sentence1: The wise man had them show him the stone;
sentence2: then he spoke: "This stone is only obeyed by the dragons who make clouds and send down the rain.

sentence1: then he spoke: "This stone is only obeyed by the dragons who make clouds and send down the rain.
sentence2: It will not do for the dragons who guard the pearls of the sea-king."

sentence1: It will not do for the dragons who guard the pearls of the sea-king."
sentence2: Then he questioned them further: "Have you the dragon-brain vapor?"

sentence1: Then he questioned them further: "Have you the dragon-brain vapor?"
sentence2: When they admitted that they had not, the wise man said: "How then will you compel the dragons to yield their treasure?"

sentence1: When they admitted that they had not, the wise man said: "How then will you compel the dragons to yield their treasure?"
sentence2: And the emperor said: "What shall we do?"

sentence1: And the emperor said: "What shall we do?"
sentence2: The wise man replied: "On the Western Ocean sail foreign merchants who deal in dragon-brain vapor.

sentence1: The wise man replied: "On the Western Ocean sail foreign merchants who deal in dragon-brain vapor.
sentence2: Some one must go to them and seek it from them.

sentence2: I also know a holy man who is an adept in the art of taming dragons, and who has prepared ten pounds of the dragon-stone.

sentence2: Some one should be sent for that as well."

sentence1: They met one of the holy man's disciples and obtained two fragments of dragon-stone from him.
sentence2: Said the wise man: "That is what we want!"

sentence1: Said the wise man: "That is what we want!"
sentence2: The emperor felt much pleased and had his jewelers carve two little boxes of the finest jade.

sentence1: The emperor felt much pleased and had his jewelers carve two little boxes of the finest jade.
sentence2: And he had an essence prepared of the very best hollowgreen wood, pasted with sea-fish lime, and hardened in the fire.

sentence1: And he had an essence prepared of the very best hollowgreen wood, pasted with sea-fish lime, and hardened in the fire.
sentence2: Then the bodies and the clothing of the messengers were rubbed with tree-wax, and they were given five hundred roasted swallows to take along with them.

sentence1: Then the bodies and the clothing of the messengers were rubbed with tree-wax, and they were given five hundred roasted swallows to take along with them.
sentence2: When they reached the dragon-castle, the little dragon who guarded the gate smelled the tree-wax, so he crouched down and did them no harm.

sentence1: When they reached the dragon-castle, the little dragon who guarded the gate smelled the tree-wax, so he crouched down and did them no harm.
sentence2: They gave him a hundred roasted swallows as a bribe to announce them to the daughter of the Dragon-King.

sentence1: They gave him a hundred roasted swallows as a bribe to announce them to the daughter of the Dragon-King.
sentence2: They were admitted to her presence and offered her the jade caskets, the vases and the four hundred roasted swallows as gifts.

sentence1: They were admitted to her presence and offered her the jade caskets, the vases and the four hundred roasted swallows as gifts.
sentence2: The dragon's daughter received them graciously, and they unfolded the emperor's letter.

sentence1: The dragon's daughter received them graciously, and they unfolded the emperor's letter.
sentence2: He could turn himself into a human being, and could interpret the language of human beings.

sentence1: He could turn himself into a human being, and could interpret the language of human beings.
sentence2: Through him the dragon's daughter learned that the emperor was sending her the gifts, and she returned them with a gift of three great pearls, seven smaller pearls and a whole bushel of ordinary pearls.

sentence1: Through him the dragon's daughter learned that the emperor was sending her the gifts, and she returned them with a gift of three great pearls, seven smaller pearls and a whole bushel of ordinary pearls.
sentence2: The messengers took leave, rode off with their pearls on a dragon's back, and in a moment they had reached the banks of the Yangtze-kiang.

sentence2: They made their way to Nanking, the imperial capital, and there handed over their treasure of gems.

sentence2: The emperor was much pleased and showed them to the wise man.

sentence1: The emperor was much pleased and showed them to the wise man.
sentence2: He said: "Of the three great pearls one is a divine wishing-pearl of the third class, and two are black dragon-pearls of medium quality.
